name: risibly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is risible (= so lacking in quality or usefulness that it deserves to be laughed at): There is no way we can accept this risibly low salary increase. He then suggested, risibly, that he did not realize that he had broken the law.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is such a risibly obvious piece of fake news.The opposition accused the government of quoting risibly exaggerated figures.The party risibly claimed that the country had the least corrupt police force in the world.
